fig3-1.caption: Figure 3.1 A plane slows down as it comes in for landing in St. Maarten. Its acceleration is in the opposite direction of its velocity. (Steve Conry,

fig3-2.caption: Figure 3.2 The car is speeding up in (a) and slowing down in (b).

fig3-6.caption: Figure 3.6 The slope of displacement versus time is velocity.

fig3-7.caption: Figure 3.7 The slope of velocity versus time is acceleration.

fig3-10.caption: Figure 3.10 Smoke rises from the tires of a dragster at the beginning of a drag race. (Lt. Col. William Thurmond. Photo courtesy of U.S. Army.)

fig3-11.caption: Figure 3.11 Astronauts train using G Force Simulators. (NASA)

fig3-12.caption: Figure 3.12 Initial conditions for rock thrown straight up.
